Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en: The goal of a present course is to study the basic functions of human body - from the molecular level to the level of whole organism. A special attention is paid to the teaching of physiological role of sensory and central nervous system.
description.et: Käsitletakse kõikide elundsüsteemide talitluse ja regulatsiooni küsimusi. Tutvustatakse füsioloogiateaduse uusimaid saavutusi. Põhjalikumalt esitatakse meele- ja kesknärvisüsteemi füsioloogia olulisemaid aspekte.

objectives.en: Physiology belongs to the fundamental sciences in medicine. Knowing of physiology is essential to medical doctor in order to understand the normal functioning of human body. Without this knowledge it is impossible to understand the process of saving and restoring of health.
objectives.et: Füsioloogia kuulub meditsiini fundamentaalteaduste hulka. Füsioloogia põhitõdede omandamine on arstile hädavajalik organismi normaalse talitluse mõistmiseks. Ilma normaalset talitlust tundmata on arstil võimatu saada aru tervisest kui normi hoidmisest ja taastamisest.

learning_outcomes.en: After completion of the course, the student should be able to:
learning_outcomes.et: Peale kursuse lõpetamist peab üliõpilane olema võimeline:

learning_outcomes.en: Explain the mechanisms for regulation of the different body functions.
learning_outcomes.et: Selgitama erinevate organismi funktsioonide füsioloogilise regulatsiooni mehhanisme.

learning_outcomes.en: Explain how regulatory mechanisms can recover equilibrium and function when the homeostasis is disturbed in a physiological system.
learning_outcomes.et: Selgitama kuidas regulatoorsed mehhanismid taastavad tasakaalu ja talitluse, kui füsioloogilise süsteemi homöostaas on häiritud.

learning_outcomes.en: Understand the physiological background of clinical problems.
learning_outcomes.et: Aru saama kliiniliste seisundite taustaks olevatest füsioloogilisest mehhanismidest.

learning_outcomes.en: Understand and be able to use simple instruments to measure physiological parameters.
learning_outcomes.et: Aru saama ja olema võimeline rakendama lihtsaid uurimisvahendeid füsioloogiliste parameetrite mõõtmiseks.

description.et: There are 8 tests during 2 semesters (maximal score is 10 points), the mean value of all tests forms a part (30%) of the final exam.

There are also 5 seminars during 2 semesters, students have to prepare for those and discuss the subject during the seminar.  All students are assessed and they can have a maximum of 10 points for a seminar. The mean value of all seminars forms a part (10%) of the final exam.

During the final exam the student has to answer the following questions:
a) ten short questions (total time for that is 15 min), each question can give 1 point,
b) three essay questions that can also contain information from the practical classes. Every question gives up to 10 points. The first question is about blood, respiratory or cardiovascular physiology, the second - about metabolism, digestive, renal or endocrine physiology, and the third - about excitatory tissues, nervous system or sensory physiology,
c) one question about the integrative physiology (integration of different organ systems' functions), the question gives up to 20 points.
The maximal total from all the exam questions is 60 points.

grade_preconditions.et:
All practical works and seminars have to be done to be allowed to take the final exam. 
Remark--  independent work (234 hours) is for the whole course (2 semesters).

grade_evaluation.et:
A total of 100 points is a maximal result for the final exam. It consists of:
- up to 30 points from tests (the mean value of all tests multiplied with a coefficient 3),
- up to 10 points from seminars (the mean value of all seminars),
- up to 60 points from the final exam in June.
According to the total points the student gets a result from A to F:
A 91-100, B 81-90, C 71-80, D 61-70, E 51-60 and F 0 -50 points.
The final exam is failed (F) if student gets less than 51 points or if student gets less than 31 points from the exam or if student gets less than 7 points from the question about integrative physiology.

debt_elimination.et: The final exam is during the exam session in June, the first option to remake the exam is at the end of June and the second option to remake is at the end of August.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.mandatory_materials: 1. Pocock G.,  Richards Ch. D. Human physiology, Oxford  University Press, 2004, 2006, 2013
resources.recommended_materials:
1. Guyton A. C. Textbook of medical physiology, W.B.Saunders Company, 2000, 2010
2. A. Despopoulos, S. Silbernagl. Color Atlas of Physiology., 2003, 2008
